demos.title: Using Bing and Google Layers with Leaflet
demos.description:
This demo takes the be Leaflet “Hello World” examples and adds layers for Google and Bing.

The base example is lifted from Leaflet's Layer Groups and Layers Control tutorial and modified, shows the switching of base map tiles with Leaflet.

I recently switched to a Leaflet plugin for Google written by Patel Shramov.

demos.title: ArcGIS Earthquake Data
demos.description: This example is the “Hello World” of mapping, the USGS feed of earthquakes for the past 7 days. I used the feed from late July, 2013, to create this earthquake map for one of the lessons in the Geospatial Revolution course.

demos.title: Mapbox Example
demos.description:
This example is the “Hello World” of mapping, the USGS feed of earthquakes for the past 7 days. I used the feed from late August, 2013, to create this earthquake map for the TileMill Crash Course.

The tutorial has you import the USGS earthquake CSV file, add a legend and change some styles, and then export 6 zoom levels to import into MapBox. Below is a link to the tutorial map tiles in an iFrame.

demos.title: Rendering a GeoJSON layer in Leaflet
demos.wordpressUrl: Rendering a GeoJSON layer in Leaflet
demos.description:
This demo is almost complete. I still have to implement the Laps feature, and implement the Google bike trails overlay. Also, there is a bug in the map provider, type and overlay menus. I believe the trigger is picking a Google overlay, like HYBRID, and then switching to OSM or Bing, which don't support that. I haven't taken the time to track down the root cause.

Use the vendor select list to change from Google to Bing. Use the Map overlay to change the map type for the selected vendor.

demos.title: GeoJSON Feature Collection
demos.wordpressUrl: How to Display Feature Collection GeoJson with Leafletâ€™s Marker Clusters
demos.description:
This example shows the use of a Leaflet GeoJSON map layer to display a Feature Collection containing my running activities from Garmin Connect. A GeoJSON layer is created using JSON output by a GeoTools FeatureCollection. Each Feature in the collection is an activity summary (no polyline).

It also demonstrates Leaflet's Marker Cluster plugin. The marker cluster map layer is used as a wrapper around the GeoJSON layer.

Finally, this demo shows a click listener on the popup to drill down into the activity. The marker cluster layer is replaced by a Leaflet GeoJSON map layer built from an activity's GeoJSON. The “Return to Search” links swaps the map layers back again.

Click on a point cluster to drill into the data, or enter search criteria to filter data on-the-fly.

demos.title: Armed Conflict in Africa
demos.description:
This demo uses the PruneCluster plugin to cluster over 99,000 incidents of armed conflict in Africa between 1971 and 2014 from the ACLED 1971 - 2014 dataset. The accompanying blog post will follow soon.

Click on point clusters to drill into the data, or use the search options to filter data on-the-fly.

demos.title: Leaflet-PIP Plugin
demos.wordpressUrl: Breaking Dependence on Vendor Map APIs with Leaflet
demos.description:
This demo uses a GeoJSON file containing Kansas counties and some overlapping shaps to show how shape events can be handled. It also introduces the Leaflet-PIP Plugin.

Hover over county names, county shapes on the map, or the college circles to trigger highlighting.

demos.title: “50-State Club” map
demos.description:
This demo uses the uses Leaflet-PIP Plugin to generate a 50-State Marathon Club style map on the fly in the web browser.

Change the race distance to change race filter.

demos.title: Privacy Geofencing
demos.description:
This demo shows privacy geofencing done on the browser-side. It is only this way because this is a static website. In the real world, privacy Geofencing would only be done on the server-side so that no private coordinates are delivered in the JSON payload as it is in the demo.

Click the numbers at the bottom of the page to see 10 examples of privacy geofencing.

demos.title: Color Gradient Map Lines
demos.wordpressUrl: Color Gradient Lines: Begin with the End in Mind
demos.description: This page demonstrates the Leaflet Hotline plugin.
